title: The League of Legends Universe is getting greater each Day
body:
Just thought that it might be time to point my Love for LoL out.

To be honest, League has the greatest Universe i´ve ever seen (or more fitting read) in Gaming for me. Its really easy to let yourself fall into each Champions Lore, the Storys, The Relations. 
I personally also almost over-enjoy triggering Ingame Interactions, could be why i love playing {{champion:223}} .

This alone will keep me a loyal League Fan and LoL as my favorite Game and Riot as favorite Company no matter how difficult actually playing the Game is.

Your Universe rocks mayor. Keep Going Story, Art and Sound Team

Short, realistic answer? Writer/editor bandwidth.

Before I got here (January 2017) there wasn't any kind of storytelling plan beyond "a bio and a color story for every new champion, and a short story whenever we can fit it in".

Now we've got more Rioters in Narrative, and we're looking ahead to more ways we can get interaction with champions, as well as characters in the lore who aren't champions. The short story 'The Principles of Strength' is a good example - Swain and Darius (and "the Faceless"...?!) plus a few more, in an illustration of how Noxus works, politically, through actual storytelling instead of info-dump.

We're going to keep leveling up, and linking more and more of our champions to the "now" in Runeterra.

If there's a reason to tell a story with Tahm Kench, we will absolutely do so. :-)

http://orig13.deviantart.net/da44/f/2013/016/8/5/uh_meme_by_gumwolf-d5rpqr0.png

A question, if I may, since you're qualified for it. 

It seems like it's become the norm recently that champions (and their comrades) get a bunch of lore when they get reworked. I'm wondering if this would extend as well to someone like Aatrox, who's getting a gameplay update but not an entire thematic overhaul. Is there anything planned for him on the lore front?

Recently we've had quite a bit of lore for the Darkin, with Kayn/Rhaast, Varus, and some other blurbs of their race mentioned here and there. In the end, we know a decent amount about Varus, Rhaast, why they were here, what their motivations are, etc, but Aatrox (muh main boi) is still lagging behind the group without any kind of real fleshing out. 

I totally understand if you're unable to talk about anything that may or may not be in the works, so this was mainly a question about if it's possible/on the table rather than if it's happening.

A great question... although, since it relates to the future, I have to be a little more vague...

We currently have three darkin champions, and there's a lot of implied lore in there. For me, personally, I'd like to see some of the implied stuff fleshed out, and help to build a more solid idea of what the darkin are, what they want, and where that might lead them and the peoples of Runeterra.

Anywhere there is a hook or something that seems incomplete/inconsistent, there's an opportunity for a story or two! ;-)

Varus' lore talks about Aatrox's defeat as a major part of the ending of the darkin war, which suggests (to me anyway) that we're going to see more Aatrox lore moving forward. ATM he's just this mysterious warrior dude who shows up sometimes throughout history to turn battles in favor of a side that's losing horribly. But the darkin are now an extraruneterrestrial race, and the idea that Aatrox was their leader of sorts is very intriguing. We'll see soon, I suppose.

I think something that should be noted (unless Aatrox's lore will be completely changed as well) is that if Aatrox has successfully possessed a host body for thousands of years then why hasn't he managed to find and free his kin? I know it may not be such an easy task for the Darkins themselves, but Varus seems to be making more progress than Aatrox (who's been around for quite a while). Even Rhaast has made it clear that if he could possess Kayn, one of the first things he would do is find his siblings and free them so that they could terrorize and exterminate the world together.

Would he _want_ to find and free his kin right then and there though?

He suffered this implied huge defeat so I'm pretty sure setting up the world before releasing them would be a better plan, since the others seem impatient.

I think Rhaast just wants to show he's a better leader than Aatrox was implied to be.

Hey Scathe, if I could offer something, I think what Swain lacks that might be necessary is any kind of relationship with another champ. For example, Eve is a very similar character, but she directly affected Vayne in the new lore and could be considered her nemesis. Tahm doesn't really have that, a character who he has affected that makes him a real villain in someone's story. Maybe even if *his* lore isn't really added onto, maybe he could be expanded on in another character's lore, even a character whose lore is a bit outdated and could use an update.
